title: Theorems proved using conjunction-form Virtual Deduction

blocks.name: elpwgdedVD
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. Theorem 86 of [Suppes] p. 47. Derived from ~ elpwg . In form of VD deduction with ` ph ` and ` ps ` as variable virtual hypothesis collections based on Mario Carneiro's metavariable concept. ~ elpwgded is ~ elpwgdedVD using conventional notation. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 23-Apr-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: sspwimp
blocks.content: If a class is a subclass of another class, then its power class is a subclass of that other class's power class. Left-to-right implication of Exercise 18 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 18. For the biconditional, see ~ sspwb . The proof ~ sspwimp , using conventional notation, was translated from virtual deduction form, ~ sspwimpVD , using a translation program. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 23-Apr-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm sspwimp(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
} = {
  iin1(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  syl(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)), wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))))
  alrimiv(hs0, wss(c0, c1), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1))))
  ex(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))
  uun0.1(wa(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  elpwgded(cv(hs0), c1, wtru, wa(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0))))
  a1i(wtru, wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  syl2an(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  id(wss(c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  id(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  elpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  ancoms(wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  sstr(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  biimpri(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  dfss2(hs0, cpw(c0), cpw(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wss(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sspwimp(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚Üí P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
} = {
  iin1(c0 ‚äÜ c1, P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
  syl(c0 ‚äÜ c1, P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1), ‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1))))
  alrimiv(hs0, c0 ‚äÜ c1, (hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1)))
  ex(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚àà P(c1))
  uun0.1((c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà P(c0)), hs0 ‚àà P(c1), hs0 ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚äÜ c1)
  elpwgded(hs0, c1, wtru, (c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà P(c0)))
  a1i(wtru, hs0 ‚àà ùïå)
  vex(hs0)
  syl2an(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ c1, c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  id(c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  syl(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  id(hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  elpwi(hs0, c0)
  ancoms(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚äÜ c1)
  sstr(hs0, c0, c1)
  biimpri(‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1))), P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
  dfss2(hs0, P(c0), P(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  diff.hs0.c(P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(P(c1))
}

blocks.name: sspwimpVD
blocks.content:
The following User's Proof is a Virtual Deduction proof (see ~ wvd1 ) using conjunction-form virtual hypothesis collections. It was completed manually, but has the potential to be completed automatically by a tools program which would invoke Mel L. O'Cat's mmj2 and Norm Megill's Metamath Proof Assistant. ~ sspwimp is ~ sspwimpVD without virtual deductions and was derived from ~ sspwimpVD . (Contributed by Alan Sare, 23-Apr-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
1:: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. A C_ B ). `
2:: ` |- (. ` .............. ` x e. ~P A ` ` ->. x e. ~P A ). `
3:2: ` |- (. ` .............. ` x e. ~P A ` ` ->. x C_ A ). `
4:3,1: ` |- (. (. A C_ B ,. x e. ~P A ). ->. x C_ B ). `
5:: ` |- x e. _V `
6:4,5: ` |- (. (. A C_ B ,. x e. ~P A ). ->. x e. ~P B ` ` ). `
7:6: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. ( x e. ~P A -> x e. ~P B ) ` ` ). `
8:7: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. A. x ( x e. ~P A -> x e. ` ` ~P B ) ). `
9:8: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. ~P A C_ ~P B ). `
qed:9: ` |- ( A C_ B -> ~P A C_ ~P B ) `
blocks.origin:
thm sspwimpVD(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
} = {
  in1(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  el1(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)), wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))))
  gen11(hs0, wss(c0, c1), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1))))
  int2(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))
  un0.1(wvhc2(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  elpwgdedVD(cv(hs0), c1, wtru, wvhc2(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0))))
  vd01(wtru, wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  el12(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  idn1(wss(c0, c1))
  el1(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  idn1(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  elpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  ancoms(wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  sstr(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  biimpri(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  dfss2(hs0, cpw(c0), cpw(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wss(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c1))
}

thm sspwimpVD(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚Üí P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
} = {
  in1(c0 ‚äÜ c1, P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))

  gen11(hs0, c0 ‚äÜ c1, (hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1)))
  int2(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚àà P(c1))

  elpwgdedVD(hs0, c1, wtru, (c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0)))
  vd01(wtru, hs0 ‚àà ùïå)
  vex(hs0)
  el12(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ c1, c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  idn1(c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  el1(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  idn1(hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  elpwi(hs0, c0)
  ancoms(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚äÜ c1)
  sstr(hs0, c0, c1)
  biimpri(‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1))), P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
  dfss2(hs0, P(c0), P(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  diff.hs0.c(P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(P(c1))
}

blocks.name: sspwimpcf
blocks.content: If a class is a subclass of another class, then its power class is a subclass of that other class's power class. Left-to-right implication of Exercise 18 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 18. ~ sspwimpcf , using conventional notation, was translated from its virtual deduction form, ~ sspwimpcfVD , using a translation program. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm sspwimpcf(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
} = {
  iin1(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  syl(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)), wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))))
  alrimiv(hs0, wss(c0, c1), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1))))
  ex(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))
  eel021old(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  vex(hs0)
  syl2an(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  id(wss(c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  id(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  elpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  impcom(wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  sstr2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  biimpar(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))
  elpwg(cv(hs0), universe, c1)
  biimpri(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  dfss2(hs0, cpw(c0), cpw(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wss(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sspwimpcf(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚Üí P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
} = {
  iin1(c0 ‚äÜ c1, P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
  syl(c0 ‚äÜ c1, P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1), ‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1))))
  alrimiv(hs0, c0 ‚äÜ c1, (hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1)))

  eel021old(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚àà P(c1), hs0 ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚äÜ c1)
  vex(hs0)
  syl2an(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ c1, c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  id(c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  syl(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  id(hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  elpwi(hs0, c0)
  impcom(c0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚äÜ c1)
  sstr2(hs0, c0, c1)
  biimpar(hs0 ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚äÜ c1, hs0 ‚àà P(c1))
  elpwg(hs0, universe, c1)
  biimpri(‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí hs0 ‚àà P(c1))), P(c0)‚äÜ P(c1))
  dfss2(hs0, P(c0), P(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  diff.hs0.c(P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(P(c1))
}

blocks.name: sspwimpcfVD
blocks.content:
The following User's Proof is a Virtual Deduction proof (see ~ wvd1 ) using conjunction-form virtual hypothesis collections. It was completed automatically by a tools program which would invokes Mel L. O'Cat's mmj2 and Norm Megill's Metamath Proof Assistant. ~ sspwimpcf is ~ sspwimpcfVD without virtual deductions and was derived from ~ sspwimpcfVD . The version of completeusersproof.cmd used is capable of only generating conjunction-form unification theorems, not unification deductions. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
1:: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. A C_ B ). `
2:: ` |- (. ` ........... ` x e. ~P A ` ` ->. x e. ~P A ). `
3:2: ` |- (. ` ........... ` x e. ~P A ` ` ->. x C_ A ). `
4:3,1: ` |- (. (. A C_ B ,. x e. ~P A ). ->. x C_ B ). `
5:: ` |- x e. _V `
6:4,5: ` |- (. (. A C_ B ,. x e. ~P A ). ->. x e. ~P B ` ` ). `
7:6: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. ( x e. ~P A -> x e. ~P B ) ` ` ). `
8:7: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. A. x ( x e. ~P A -> x e. ` ` ~P B ) ). `
9:8: ` |- (. A C_ B ->. ~P A C_ ~P B ). `
qed:9: ` |- ( A C_ B -> ~P A C_ ~P B ) `

thm sspwimpcfVD(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
} = {
  in1(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  el1(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)), wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))))
  gen11(hs0, wss(c0, c1), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1))))
  int2(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))
  el021old(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  vex(hs0)
  el12(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  idn1(wss(c0, c1))
  el1(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  idn1(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  elpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  impcom(wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  sstr2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  biimpar(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))
  elpwg(cv(hs0), universe, c1)
  biimpri(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)))), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  dfss2(hs0, cpw(c0), cpw(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wss(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c1))
}

blocks.name: suctrALTcf
blocks.content: The sucessor of a transitive class is transitive. ~ suctrALTcf , using conventional notation, was translated from virtual deduction form, ~ suctrALTcfVD , using a translation program. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm suctrALTcf(class c0) {
  |- wi(wtr(c0), wtr(csuc(c0)))
} = {
  iin1(wtr(c0), wtr(csuc(c0)))
  syl(wtr(c0), wtr(csuc(c0)), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0))))))
  alrimivv(hs0, hs1, wtr(c0), wi(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0))))
  ex(wtr(c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)))
  eel2122old(wtr(c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wi(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0))), wi(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0))), wo(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)))
  3expia(wtr(c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)))
  eel0321old(wtr(c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wss(c0, csuc(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl3an(wtr(c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wtr(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))
  id(wtr(c0))
  id(wcel(cv(hs1), c0))
  3impib(wtr(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  trel(c0, cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  ex(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)))
  eel021old(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wss(c0, csuc(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  sssucid(c0)
  syl2an(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), csuc(c0))), wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))

blocks.content:
The following User's Proof is a Virtual Deduction proof (see ~ wvd1 ) using conjunction-form virtual hypothesis collections. The conjunction-form version of completeusersproof.cmd. It allows the User to avoid superflous virtual hypotheses. This proof was completed automatically by a tools program which invokes Mel L. O'Cat's mmj2 and Norm Megill's Metamath Proof Assistant. ~ suctrALTcf is ~ suctrALTcfVD without virtual deductions and was derived automatically from ~ suctrALTcfVD . The version of completeusersproof.cmd used is capable of only generating conjunction-form unification theorems, not unification deductions. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
1:: ` |- (. Tr A ->. Tr A ). `
2:: ` |- (. ` ......... ` ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) ->. ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ). `
3:2: ` |- (. ` ......... ` ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) ->. z e. y ). `
4:: ` |- (. ` ................................... ....... ` y e. A ->. y e. A ). `
5:1,3,4: ` |- (. (. Tr A ,. ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ` ` , y e. A ). ->. z e. A ). `
6:: ` |- A C_ suc A `
7:5,6: ` |- (. (. Tr A ,. ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ` ` , y e. A ). ->. z e. suc A ). `
8:7: ` |- (. (. Tr A ,. ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ` ` ). ->. ( y e. A -> z e. suc A ) ). `
9:: ` |- (. ` ................................... ...... ` y = A ->. y = A ). `
10:3,9: ` |- (. ` ........ ` (. ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) , y = A ). ->. z e. A ). `
11:10,6: ` |- (. ` ........ ` (. ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) , y = A ). ->. z e. suc A ). `
12:11: ` |- (. ` .......... ` ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) ->. ( y = A -> z e. suc A ) ). `
13:2: ` |- (. ` .......... ` ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) ->. y e. suc A ). `
14:13: ` |- (. ` .......... ` ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) ->. ( y e. A \/ y = A ) ). `
15:8,12,14: ` |- (. (. Tr A ,. ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ` ` ). ->. z e. suc A ). `
16:15: ` |- ` ` (. Tr A ->. ( ( z e. y /\ y e. ` ` suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ). `
17:16: ` |- ` ` (. Tr A ->. A. z A. y ( ( z e. ` ` y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ). `
18:17: ` |- ` ` (. Tr A ->. Tr suc A ). `
qed:18: ` |- ( Tr A -> Tr suc A ) `
